H0.text: Rice is the plant grown for food.

H1.text: Tobacco is the plant grown for food.

H2.text: Orchid is a plant grown for food.

H3.text: Cotton is the plant that is grown for food.

A4.text: Curing and subsequent aging of tobacco leaves contributes to the smoothness of the smoke.

A5.text: The tubers of terrestrial orchids (mainly early purple orchid, Orchis mascula) are ground to a powder and used for cooking, such as in the hot beverage salep and ice cream.

A6.text: Some saprophytic orchid species of the group Gastrodia produce potatoâ€‘like tubers and were eaten by native peoples in Australia and can be cultivated, notably Gastrodia sesamoides.
